data.text: Brooks C17 saddle for Long Bike Packing Trips
Have you tried the Brooks C17 for long bike packing trips? I would appreciate any feedback! Thanks
I've got that very seat on my bike. Have not done long treks yet. But... got it for that reason.
data.author: Brian Gallagher

data.text: I hated it. It's somehow bouncy and hard at the same time. And the surface texture is not a good thing imo. There's a ton of used ones for sale so I know I'm not the only one. Go with leather and thank me later.
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: Exact same experience here, follow Jeff‚Äôs advice ü§ô
data.author: Justin Tremblay

data.text: I'd like to also throw in my 2 cents and say Jeff is spot on. I used mine for one ride.
data.author: Josh Sapp

data.text: I have it on one of my bikes - love it. i was a bit skeptical as I've always been a fan of the leather saddles but it's now my favorite over the B17s I have on my other bikes. No break in period, weatherproof, looks great.
data.author: Rob Peters

data.text: I have the c17 carved on my bike. Have done several several multi-day trips and many long rides on it. I think the saddle is super comfy, shape works really well for me. Perfect amount of compliance & support (for me). I will echo an above comment though, I don‚Äôt love the texture, especially when it was new, the top was too ‚Äúgrippy‚Äù and would snag riding shorts. After ‚Äúbreaking in‚Äù this issue went away for me. I really value not having to worry about getting it wet like the leather options. I think saddle choice is super personal and will vary greatly depending on the person, a lot of shops will have ‚Äútester‚Äù saddles to lend out, I‚Äôd go that route! What I‚Äôll also say is buying a nice saddle that works for you is a great choice, even if it‚Äôs a little pricey. Can always move it to future bikes.
data.author: Zachary Perszyk

data.text: I agree with Jeff in the above comment. I wanted to like it, but I had the same issues, plus it wasn‚Äôt nearly as comfortable as my B17‚Äôs.
data.author: Paul G. Rytlewski

data.text: It really depends on your sit bones. I hated C17, but I love C15 crved.
data.author: Bo Ban

data.text: Love mine, but as you can tell, it's love/hate.
data.author: Alain Mendo√ßa

data.text: I‚Äôm on the hate side. Couldn‚Äôt get rid of it fast enough.
data.author: Brian Gangelhoff

data.text: me too. I tried the cut out C-17 over a couple days, it is so hard that it injured my butt, 10 months later it still hurts around my sit bones.
data.author: Guillaume Dougados

data.text: Got the C17 carved. between 30 min to 6 hours on the saddle, no problems at all. super comfortable.
data.author: Jo√£o F√©lix

data.text:
Brooks Cambium All Weather made of vulcanized natural rubber and Organic cotton canvas. All ready broke in. Is a different animal. https://www.amazon.com/Brooks-England-Cambium-Weather-Saddle/dp/B075HGFSXP/ref=sxts_rp_s_a1_0?crid=329DJJ7G8A462&cv_ct_cx=brooks%2Bc19%2Bcambium%2Bsaddle&keywords=brooks%2Bc19%2Bcambium%2Bsaddle&pd_rd_i=B075HGFSXP&pd_rd_r=bd05acb4-fdae-4e5a-ad20-a0f241695da9&pd_rd_w=c8ebk&pd_rd_wg=naCyj&pf_rd_p=4bf4bfb7-01d6-422f-8e64-ff8707d77d6c&pf_rd_r=C8WKAGA5HF6DCGWWSN28&qid=1650549550&sprefix=brooks%2Bc19%2Caps%2C243&sr=1-1-5985efba-8948-4f09-9122-d605505c9d1e&th=1&psc=1
Brooks England Cambium All Weather Bike Seat - High Mileage, Waterproof, Carved/Standard Bicycle Saddle (C15, C17, C19)
amazon.com
data.author: Fred Vaughn

data.text: This is the exact same saddle as the OP is asking about. NOT a different animal at all. They come in three different widths that can apparently make all the difference. I measured my sit bones and went with the 17 and hated it with a passion.
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: Did not care for it. But I love my Selle Anatomica
data.author: Rod Stallings

data.text: I have a Selle Anatomica for sale with cover and leather dressing liquid. $100
data.author: Bruce R. Schultz

data.text: Go for the carved models. I ridden over 10,000 miles on my c-17
data.author: Greg Johnson

data.text: I've had several B17s and C17s. I think they are all different. For example, my black B17 is very soft and comfortable, but it also got soaked in a hard rain, then ridden 100 miles. My brown B17 was much stiffer and felt like thicker leather. My first gen C17 feels softer and more flexible than my All-Weather C17 Carved, but I love the All-Weather because I don't have to think about it‚Äîat all. I think people either love or hate Brooks saddles as they don't seem to work for everyone. I hated my Selle Anatomica, it felt like it cut into the insides of my thighs. Hard delete.
data.author: Bill Ferriot

data.text: All saddles hurt. It's your arse that you gotta break in not the saddle ü§£
data.author: Ryan Magee

data.text: Exactly, have a cup of cement and harden the f*ck up!
data.author: Idriss Musa

data.text: Me and my girlfriend are on the road for 6 weeks already both ride C17's on our surly ogres we love them, although some shorts feel quite slippery on the saddle but that's regular shortd not bibs
data.author: Mathias Verreyt

data.text: Mine started squeeking after one year. Pretty annoying
data.author: Dries Taillieu

data.text: Tried it and it wasn‚Äôt for me. Got an infinity saddle instead and have never looked back.
data.author: Justin Ammerman

data.text: I have one on my fat bike, and it does have a constant squeak...would drive me mad on a long trip.
data.author: Vincent Peragine

data.text: Love it! Before I would get sore about 35 miles into a ride. 154 mile day with no pain last year. Many back to back 70+ mile days. A sore rear is no longer an issue for me thanks to this very saddle.
data.author: Al Christensen

data.text: I have c17 carved on my fat bike and c15 carved on my drop bar bike. Both are amazing for me. I have not done multi day trips, but at 6-8 hours in the saddle, I‚Äôm perfectly comfortable. I also ride almost exclusively in jeans unless it‚Äôs winter. I don‚Äôt wear padded shorts
data.author: Ryan McClure

data.text: I did not like it for backpacking. Good for around town.
data.author: Jeremiah Brown

data.text: you‚Äôre using it wrong. It‚Äôs supposed to go on your bike.
data.author: Straffe Lycke

data.text: ü§£ bike packing oops
data.author: Jeremiah Brown

data.text: I use a c19----if you are used to a B17, the C17 is actually narrower, go with the C19 for the same effective width as the b17
data.author: Tim Barber

data.text: I have 7k miles on mine all on long distance trips
data.author: Connor O'Reilly

data.text: I like the original c17 with the cloth in the saddle top, but the newer "all weather" has been problematic. Had lots of problems with the seat material rubbing on the rails and squeaking and driving me crazy.
data.author: Brent Shultz

data.text: I love my original cloth c17 and have purchased 2 newer all weather c17 and I have to say they are not as comfortable, actually at times, a little painful after 2 hours or so. Find it odd because I have such success with my original one
data.author: Matt Sysko

data.text: I snagged a c13 thinking it would be great. It hurts. I know what you‚Äôre going through. Went back to my B17 imperial
data.author: Justin Zabrocki

data.text: For me, Very comfortable and feels broken in immediately. I have two c15 and two c13. All are carved all weather versions
data.author: Drew Molnar

data.text: I have both Brooks and Selle Anatomica, I prefer the Selle Anatomica. The Anatomical Of The Cells
data.author: Marcus Chiu

data.text: Not bike packing, but a DAMn long day ... I've completed The Day Across Minnesota (The DAMn) three times - this is a 240-mile one-day ride on gravel roads across Minnesota. Each year, I've used a different Brooks: B-17; C-17; and C-15 Carved. I think I'd say my favorite was the C-17, but I might recommend the carver version.
data.author: Chris Nelson

data.text: I have done 2 tours on my C17. One tour was 1,000km across BC. The other 800km in Quebec. Excellent saddle. The only small problem I had was a bit of rub on my thigh after about 150km in pretty humid conditions. Each person will need to make the decision if they want/need a cutout in their saddle, but if you don't need one this is a pretty great saddle that looks very good. I'll be putting the more aggressive model on my gravel racing bike.
data.author: Josh Compagna

data.text: I love the C15 saddle but I believe they have a design flaw with the casting piece for nose support and the rubber shell breaks at the stress riser at the back edge of the support. A 1/4‚Äù radius on the edge of the casting would make these saddles last a LOT longer. I‚Äôve broken 3 of them and while I love how the feel I can‚Äôt justify $100 saddles every year.
data.author: David Moechnig

data.text: Get the one with the cutout. You will thank me later.
data.author: Chris Bonjour

data.text: Gonna use the one with cutout on 400km Fleche Velocio next Sunday.... We'll see after that :)
data.author: Ivan Perak

data.text: I have a cut-out C17 on my gravel bike, and a cutout C15 on my mtb - they are great. Tried a non cutout C13 (132mm) but that was way too hard. Will be buying another cutout C15 for my other bike, they're ace.
data.author: Guy Bowden

data.text: I have a C17 Cambium Carved that I got for adventure racing. I couldn't get comfortable on it. Ended up with a Selle SMP TRK Gel Saddle. Worked much better for me. But butts are individual, so maybe the C17 will work for you. It gets good reviews.
data.author: Will Murphy

data.text: I used it on a trip with several 100 mile rides. Works for me, but I have to say, it's not as comfy as my B17
data.author: Karel Castelein

data.text: I have the carved version, still not tested on a trip but on a couple of centuries. It feels like sitting on a cloud To be fair, my previous saddle was pretty bad
data.author: Luca Basanisi

data.text: for me best saddle i ever had.
data.author: Mike Beard

data.text: It‚Äôs horrible
data.author: Steven Bowie

data.text: Its wonderful
data.author: Tyler Longpine

data.text: terrible saddle both carved and standard if you‚Äôre going to go Brooks go leather
data.author: Steven Bowie

data.text: Great saddle both carved and standard.
data.author: Tyler Longpine

data.text: I've got the carbon railed one and I like it a lot.
data.author: James Fuller

data.text: Measure your sitbones, consult bike fitter and choose between c13, c15 and c17accordingly. Get informed on what wil fit you, not other people.
data.author: Rok Pajer

data.text: that's far to sensible an approach
data.author: Gafyn Meredith

data.text: Overrated and overpriced‚Ä¶
data.author: Marcel Besemer

data.text: I have one and its held up well. It seems very durable. I am not sensitive in the seat area so I can't really comment on the comfort. I often bikepack on a hard plastic Cinnelli saddle that has zero padding.
data.author: Galen Campbell

data.text: i‚Äôve been riding one for years. It‚Äôs been he only saddle i would ride for long trips like that
data.author: Michael Hamm

data.text: How do you think the cambium compares to the traditional brooks seat? Wanted something waterproof.
data.author: John Youker

data.text: I felt the cambium resulted in more friction than traditional leather. In wet conditions, the cover Brooks provides is quite adequate for keeping the seat protected and is quite comfortable to ride (as comfy or more so than the cambium imho).
data.author: Lynn Ballard

data.text: great, thanks! Indidnt realize there was a cover. My LBS never mentioned a cover. Is that a separate order item or does it come with the seat?
data.author: John Youker

data.text: just hopping in here! There is a Brooks bike seat cover by Planet Bike (I think is the brand). I got it at MEC, but I know REI has it too. It rolls up under the seat when not using, and fits on super easily to keep it waterproof. It's also about $15 CAD, so super cheap and worth it (and comfortable). It also only takes about 5 seconds to put on when it starts raining.
data.author: Alex Mickelson

data.text: amazon has it for $13.50 usd. And saddle (black, b17) i found for $125 usd as well. Im gonna try it out. Has to be better that a WTB Volt.
data.author: John Youker

data.text: Much better
data.author: Chris Wright

data.text: Not very durable at all. I loved them initially. Got three for my three bikepacking rigs and all of them have failed.
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: They were warrantied. The warranties failed. Now Brooks won't warranty the warranties. They tend to form a crease towards the front of the nose. This crease eventually cracks completely and leaves you totally screwed. The carbon rail version has a tendency to split at the very back of the carbon rail if used with a saddlebag.
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: so how about the original brooks seat for bikepacking and looooong days in the saddle? Ive never ridden one.
data.author: John Youker

data.text: I do Custom Leatherwork. Send them to me.
data.author: Tim Attwood

data.text: I had this issues with older Cambiums. Haven‚Äôt had the same problem with the new ones. No issues at all.

data.text: C17 is comfortable for about 50 miles. B17 is comfortable for every mile
data.author: Bob Eiserman

data.text: 100% accurate for me.

data.text: I had the version with the cutout in it and found it to flex too much for my liking. Otherwise I liked it. I never had a chance to try the regular version. Someday perhaps.

data.text: I have 2 lightly used Cambium All Weathers to re-home, if interested.

data.text: I‚Äôve put 1000+ miles on mine last year and it‚Äôs been amazing. The rubber has some give which is nice. The seat is a little far back on the saddle, but once I understood that it was perfect. I chose it over the leather cuz I‚Äôm not great with maintenance. No regrets.
data.author: Sylvan Hemingway Jr

data.text: It‚Äôs not a B17 (comfort) for sure
data.author: Rob Robertson

data.text: Agree, less comfortable than the B17, but no worries about weather. And more comfortable than everything else I‚Äôve tried.

data.text: Done about 15,000 km off road and on road with one and been very happy with it

data.text: Love it, have the cut out model

data.text: I have the cutout version with pearl padded shorts it was great, 160 plus miles, 6 to 8 hour days on the bike

data.text: I wouldn't ride on anything else! Did LEJOG in October using a B17 saddle and had no discomfort at all after 1136 miles.

data.text: I have about 10,000 miles on my collection of c-17‚Äôs they‚Äôre literally on all my bikes now I love them so much.
data.author: Andy Hatch

data.text: I have one of the c14 cambium. It‚Äôs ok. It‚Äôs still plastic, not totally light weight. It started to squeak recently. The issue, I‚Äôve had many Selle Italia seats that are simply the best. This on hurts after 2/3 days of multi day rides. It‚Äôs only cool because the bearded single speeders say it‚Äôs cool.

data.text: I have had both the cut out and uncut saddles of the C17. I prefer the cutout.

data.text: I hopped on a brand new c17 no break in at all and proceeded to ride over 500 miles in a 4 day period. Have never been pickie about saddles. Now will ride nothing else.
data.author: Joe Deppe

data.text: Did the trans am bike race on one before being hit in ky. No saddle sores and was awesome
data.author: Michael Lanning

data.text: I have 3 of the c17 carved, about to be 4. Best saddle I‚Äôve ever tried!
data.author: Patrick Farnsworth

data.text: Hell no. Maybe the cutout version. I've used this saddle for years poking around town, etc for the weather-proofing aspect, but for longer distances I've reverted back to my B17. Much much better.
data.author: Terrell Harrington

data.text: C15 cambium and love it.
data.author: Hect Garrum

data.text: I have the 15 and the 19. Go 19

data.text: Yes. Love it.

data.text: Just did the Natchez Trace Parkway on the C-17 carved I've been really happy with the seat Get the one that fits your seat bones had to see 15 before and it just didn't work
data.author: Eric Cummins

data.text: I have one, it split on the side and brooks basically told me to kick rocks. The shop it came from says the bought it third party so no dice on a warranty replacement. I guess I'll try and repair it because it's so comfortable.
data.author: Terry Woods

data.text: The most important aspect of long distance bicycle riding is comfort‚Ä¶..
data.author: David O'Neill

data.text: I have 4 of the C-17‚Äôs, one C-17 carved, and a C-13 carved. I like the C-17 carved the best. I have boatloads of miles on them over many years.
data.author: Mark Courtenay

data.text: I had one and didn't like it. I really like the b17 though
data.author: Philip Yates

data.text: I sit far back on saddles so the rivets don‚Äôt work for me.
data.author: Joe Jeffery

data.text: My feedback: total ass hatchet. Gotta have a B-17 Special on err bike.
data.author: Neil Doran

data.text: dont see paying $50 bucks xtra for the special for pretty rails. Lol. But to each their own.
data.author: John Youker

data.text: I hear you. Dunno about the rails but I do like the hand set rivets. But really it‚Äôs about the better quality leather that cradles my ass just so. My three Specials are going on 10+ years so that +$50 cost amortized over the life of the saddle‚Ä¶insignificant IMO.
data.author: Neil Doran

data.text: truth. Same leather on the other one.
data.author: John Youker

data.text: I like my C15 a lot.
data.author: Matthew Hall

data.text: I have an older c-17 and the canvas is a bit rough. It‚Äôs really comfy but it wears my bibs a bit faster. I have a newer, smoother, one with a cut out, and absolutely love it. They‚Äôre both really comfortable but the newer one that has the smoother surface is heaps better.
data.author: Erik Jansen

data.text: Only up to 50kms so far‚Ä¶loving it.
data.author: Chris Dixon

data.text: I‚Äôve got a C-17 carved, did 220ish miles over 3 days, 85% of which was off road and I found it was really comfortable. Done many miles on it since then and still no issues.
data.author: Dan Riches

data.text: I have been riding Brooks saddles for over 50 years. I ride a B15 every day. I own about 20 now, including a horse hair spring seat from the 30's. I have two C15's. I have about 1000 miles split up between the two because one started cracking at the nose from the support under the rubber surface. With all that being said, I don't like the design. Its not comfortable as any of my others.
data.author: Scott R Chamberlain

data.text: I'll let you know at the end of June, after I give my new one a workout.

data.text: For me Brooks is the most comfortable out of the box saddle available.
